org.chronos.chronodb.api

Interface ChangeSetEntry

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChangeSetEntryImpl

    public interface ChangeSetEntry
    Represents a single entry in the set of changes made by a ChronoDBTransaction before committing.

    Instances of this interface are always held in-memory. Upon commit, they are forwarded to the data store to persist the changes.

    Instances of this interface are simple data structures with no logic, and are assumed to be immutable.

    Instances of this interface must implement #hashCode() and #equals(Object) based only on the QualifiedKey.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ChangeSetEntry createChange(QualifiedKey key, java.lang.Object newValue, PutOption... options)
      Creates a regular change instance, i.e. any change that is not a deletion.
      static ChangeSetEntry createDeletion(QualifiedKey key)
      Creates a new deletion instance.
      java.lang.String getKey()
      Returns the key that was changed.
      java.lang.String getKeyspace()
      Returns the name of the keyspace where the change occurred.
      java.util.Set<PutOption> getOptions()
      Returns the (put-)options for this change.
      java.lang.Object getValue()
      Returns the new value associated with the key.
      boolean isRemove()
      Checks if this change entry corresponds to a "remove" operation that removed a key altogether.
      boolean isSet()
      Checks if this change entry corresponds to a "set" operation that changed the value of a key.

    • Method Detail

      • createChange

        static ChangeSetEntry createChange(QualifiedKey key,
                                   java.lang.Object newValue,
                                   PutOption... options)
        Creates a regular change instance, i.e. any change that is not a deletion.

        For deletions, please use createDeletion(QualifiedKey) instead.

        Parameters:
        key - The key that was modified (inserted or altered). Must not be null.
        newValue - The new value that is assigned to the given key. Must not be null.
        options - The options to store alongside the change. May be empty, must not be null.
        Returns:
        The newly created change set entry. Never null.

      • createDeletion

        static ChangeSetEntry createDeletion(QualifiedKey key)
        Creates a new deletion instance.

        For insertions or modifications, please use createChange(QualifiedKey, Object, PutOption...) instead.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to be marked as deleted. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The newly created change set entry. Never null.

      • getKey

        java.lang.String getKey()
        Returns the key that was changed.
        Returns:
        The qualified key. Never null.

      • getKeyspace

        java.lang.String getKeyspace()
        Returns the name of the keyspace where the change occurred.
        Returns:
        The name of the keyspace. Never null.

      • getValue

        java.lang.Object getValue()
        Returns the new value associated with the key.

        If this method returns null, it indicates the deletion of the key.

        Returns:
        The value, or null if the key was deleted.

      • getOptions

        java.util.Set<PutOption> getOptions()
        Returns the (put-)options for this change.
        Returns:
        The immutable set of options. Never null. May be empty.

      • isSet

        boolean isSet()
        Checks if this change entry corresponds to a "set" operation that changed the value of a key.

        The term "set" is interpreted here as in "set key X to value Y", where X and Y are non-null. It is mutually exclusive with isRemove().

        Returns:
        true if this is a "set" operation, otherwise false.

      • isRemove

        boolean isRemove()
        Checks if this change entry corresponds to a "remove" operation that removed a key altogether.

        The term "remove" is interpreted here as in "remove key X", where X is non-null. It is mutually exclusive with isSet().

        Returns:
        true if this is a "remove" operation, otherwise false.
